creator: uddirulz@gmail.com
p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Hello,
Could you give us some feedback as we asked for in the BUG 55325 ?

This will help us diagnose and fix potential issue if any.

I personally use very frequently JMeter on Physical and Virtual machines and never faced this issue for now.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
As far as I can tell, the JTL file was not produced by the JMX file.

For example, there is a sample with the label WRS_Student_Nettext_00_Windows_IE_Launch
This appears to have been generated by a Transaction Controller (TC), but there is no such element in the test plan.

There are some non-zero idle-time entries in the JTL file.
That is very unusual; as far as I know none of the standard JMeter samplers use the idle-time feature. These are all in what appear to be TC entries, so perhaps there is an issue with the TC in that regard.
